meanings.definition: To move or go from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: I shool to the park every day.
meanings.sent2: The cat will shool across the room.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to shool up the tree for a better view.
meanings.sent4: The river shooled swiftly towards the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The wind made the leaves shool around the yard.

meanings.definition: To move quickly or in a hurried manner.
meanings.sent1: She had to shool to catch the bus.
meanings.sent2: The rabbit shooled away from the fox.
meanings.sent3: The kids had to shool to finish their homework before dinner.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds shooled across the sky.
meanings.sent5: The fire alarm made everyone shool out of the building.

meanings.sent1: We saw a big shool of fish swimming in the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The shool of fish moved gracefully in the water.
meanings.sent3: The fish in the shool all swam together in harmony.
meanings.sent4: The shool of fish shimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The shool of fish darted away as the shark approached.
